name: Grand Palladium Jamaica Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Stayed in July 2009
reviews.title: Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Family of 4 plus two grandparents
reviews.title: Excellent Vacation!!

reviews.text: Booked through aircanadavactions.com
reviews.title: Best Xmas and new year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived in the airport and made a mad rush to the A/C bus however the bus driver was very slow and we had to wait outside with kids. Wasn't impressed with that. No drinks given from what I remember.
reviews.title: Average Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bus ride is long, scary and bumpy, so if you have little kids, make sure an adult is holding on to them.
reviews.title: what a fabulous way to spend the new year....

reviews.text: I returned to Jamaica at the end of November for the second time in 2011. I love this Island and it's people. Last stay was at The Riu in Mo Bay , this time The Grand Palladium Jamaica side. The entire trip was a Fun, Sun and Rum ! The service was great. I traveled with two girl friends and we stayed on the 3rd floor building 12..across from the 'Relax' pool. The location , our room and housekeeping was good. Could of used a colder refrigerator and more bottled water, but that's it for complaints.....really nothing we couldn't live with. The resort is beautiful , the maintance staff always puttering around fixing, painting, landscaping. They are great to stop a chat as your walking around....I found all the staff there equally as friendly. The bar staff around the pool were talented and fun... Say Hi to Owen from Mello ( he's mainly at the small bar on the Jamaica side of the main pool) another Hi the Roan 'blu' from the lifeguard staff. These guys helped make my vacation the fun it was :)
reviews.title: **GRAND TIME at The Grand Palladium ! **

reviews.text: The evening entertainment at the Infinity bar above the main pool was a nightly haunt as was the disco til 2am then off to the visit the staff at the Sport bar for a late night snack. This was something I loved about this resort vs the Riu....there was hot food available all night and they were happy to serve you....if your like me and skip a big supper in order to keep the party going...you NEED something by the time 2 am comes along and the nacho chip with cheese on them at the Riu just didn't do it for me.
reviews.title: Returned for the 5th time to the Grand Palladium

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you decide to stay at the Palladium and arrive at the front desk while Chris is on duty, he'll take good care of you, very professional and a great sense of humor too.
reviews.title: an ok stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from the Grand Palladium. It was our 5th visit. The Hotel is only 3 years old and they are already upgrading the facility. Their remodling crew is constantly painting and makig sure that everything is in top condition. The food was delicious. We had steak, shrimp, pizza, pork, salmon and various other dishes. One can always find any food type that one desires.
reviews.title: Amazing Wedding and Vacation - will never forget:-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was hot but there was always a cool breeze. One night the hotel had a huge bonfire on the beach with snacks and drinks. Another night there was a beach barbecue in the evening for dinner.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was awful and the drinks extremely watered down. If you enjoy well prepared food and tasty drinks this is not the place for you. The restaurants had at least a two hour wait if you tried to eat a reasonable hour, forcing you to eat in the buffet areas which provide more bulk tasteless food. The waitstaff do not want to do anything strenuous really, like bring you that second glass of water you request. If you ask again, they respond with attitude.
reviews.title: Wouldn't reccomd this resort to anyone

reviews.text: In addition to the food, the hotel itself was pretty to look at from an esthetic standpoint (pretty to look at) but it was managed very poorly. Each employee was very unhelpful and do not accommodate their guests properly. They are extremely unorganized and when asked to speak to staff regarding issues or complaints they apologize but neglect to fix the problem/issue.
reviews.title: Awesome girls trip!

reviews.text: Also, keep an eye on your electronics and valuables. My smartphone was stolen out of the hotel room and the hotel denied any type of compensation for this matter. They insisted their staff was sincere and would never steal peoples belongings out of the room.
reviews.title: My 2nd time @ Grand Palladium

reviews.text: Honestly save your money for a different vacation because this hotel seems to be nothing but headaches.
reviews.title: just returned loved it

reviews.text: This was my first trip to Jamaica with 3 of my closest girlfriends, & we had a blast! If you've never been to an all inclusive resort, you don't really know what to expect. This was my 2nd time at one & the food, drinks, & service were great. Of course its not 5 star cuisines, but you have to keep in mind it is a foreign country. The food is obviously going to taste different no matter what. We made many friends throughout our stay with the staff. They kept us laughing. The resort itself is HUGE so we did have to walk alot, but so what! A little excercise never hurt anyone. Would def return!! :)
reviews.title: Honest Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: VERY BAD ..
reviews.title: Never more !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are there dec - january , but was a bad ..Jamaican peoples very lazy !!!
reviews.title: Very Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After an extremely hard year my partner and I really deserved a break. We knew we wanted to go to Jamaica, but didn't know where. Thomas Cook recommended the G.P.J.R.S as being one of the best resorts in Jamaica, so we booked a week!
reviews.title: Indian Wedding on January 7th
Would not recommend, especially if "walking a-lot" is not your thing
reviews.text: So we arrived in Jamaica airport and was sent to our bus. Once everyone was on a very rude and aggressive woman done the head count, we thought we were on a bus going to prison the way this was conducted, not the best first impression at all. We arrived at the hotel and was given a very strong and lovely fruit punch, which was great.

We checked in and was branded with a light purple band that was our tag for the week.. Little bit gutted as we both hate having them on our wrists for a weeks and have never had to have them at any other all inclusive.. So the purple band is the lowest criteria. I asked what the red bad was for as the other guests next to us had one on and the reply was 'they are VIP'.. Okay I thought so are we just nobody's??
reviews.title: Loved it!!

aka: Grand Palladium Jamaica Resort And Spa
